incidents.name: Using Okta, Azure, GitHub or Google Group selector with SSH with Access for Infrastructure resulting in users having unauthorized access to infrastructure targets

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

When an Okta, Azure, GitHub or Google Group selector is used, all SSH policies will match to users having unauthorized access to infrastructure targets. Users must still pass all other components of the policy. Infrastructure Access applications without the affected Group Selectors and all other Access application types are not impacted.

components.name: Access

incidents.name: Increased Errors for R2 and Durable Objects in the Western European (WEUR) Region

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare became aware of, and mitigated an issue with R2 and Durable Objects which potentially impacted multiple customers from 15:07 to 15:13 UTC.
R2 and Durable Objects briefly experienced an elevated level of overload errors in the WEUR region.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages, Workers, API and Dashboard issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
Cloudflare Dashboard is also affected: users might observe delays and/or errors. The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard service issues: Password reset failures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Impact is limited and only affecting a small amount of users. We are continuing to investigate the root cause of the issue.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard: Some customers attempting to perform password resets will observe error responses, and emails are not being sent.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
We are currently working on a resolution. More updates to follow shortly.
